author: etan_status
content:
ProgressiveList/ProgressiveBitlist are ready for implementation, not expecting big changes there (tests are available, too).

ProgressiveContainer/CompatibleUnion is an evolution of StableContainer/Profile, addressing feedback that has been collected since then:
- The fixed capacity [N] is gone; instead of a triangle shape with fixed size, it uses the progressive shape from the new lists. Likewise, instead of a Bitvector[N] mix-in, it is a ProgressiveBitlist mix-in. This reduces hash count and is more flexible, as N no longer needs to be properly sized
- Optionals are gone; especially in Go they were tricky to implement and made things complex
- CompatibleUnion is a more compact (especially when nested) serialization that can be used for conditional fields. Does not touch merkleization

https://pureth.guide/implementations-ssz/
I have added an implementation tracker here.
